provisions.title: Article 6 - of Law n° 44 bis/2011 of 26/11/2011
provisions.content: governing the statute of Prosecutors and other staff the National Public Prosecution Authority is modified and complemented as follows: “The Assistants to Prosecutors are the following: 1º assistants to Prosecutors at the level of Prosecutor General’s Office; 2º assistants to Prosecutors at the Intermediate Level; 3º assistants to Prosecutors at the Primary Level.”

provisions.title: Article 2 - General requirements for being
provisions.content: Prosecutor

provisions.title: Article 10 - of Law n° 44 bis/2011 of 26/11/2011
provisions.content: governing the statute of Prosecutors and other staff the National Public Prosecution Authority is modified and complemented as follows: “Any person seeking the post of a Prosecutor must: 1º be a Rwandan national; 2º be at least twenty-one (21) years old; 3º pass the recruitment test, except Prosecutor General, the Deputy Prosecutor General and Chief Prosecutor at Intermediate Level; 4º have at least a Bachelor’s Degree in Law; 5º have a certificate of successful completion the training programme offered by recognized institute of legal practice, except members of the Bureau of the National Public Prosecution Authority and Chief Prosecutor the Intermediate Level; 6º be a person of integrity; 7º not have been convicted of the crime discrimination and sectarianism; 8º not have been convicted of the crime genocide; 9º not have been convicted of the crime genocide ideology; 10º not have been convicted of the crime corruption and embezzlement of public property; 11º not to have been dismissed from office, abandoned his/her duties or refused to resume his/her duties after the end of the period suspension or after being requested to do 12º not have been deprived of civil or political rights by courts; 13º not to have been sentenced to a term imprisonment of at least six (6) months final judgment.”

provisions.title: Article 3 - Specific requirements to be appointed
provisions.content: Prosecutor at the Intermediate Level

provisions.title: Article 4 - Appointment of a Chief Prosecutor
provisions.content: the Intermediate Level

provisions.title: Article 11 - bis is inserted in Law n° 44 bis/2011
provisions.content: 26/11/2011 governing the statute of Prosecutors other staff of the National Public Prosecution Authority, to read as follows: “Article 11 bis: Appointment of Chief Prosecutor at the Intermediate Level The Chief Prosecutor at the Intermediate Level selected by the Prosecutor General after consultation with the Prosecutor General’s office. The Prosecutor General submits to the High Council of the National Public Prosecution Authority candidate selected for the vacant post of Chief Prosecutor at the Intermediate Level for approval.”

provisions.title: Article 13 - of Law n° 44 bis/2011 of 26/11/2011
provisions.content: governing the statute of Prosecutors and other staff the National Public Prosecution Authority is modified and complemented as follows: “In order to be appointed a Prosecutor and be put the rank corresponding to such a post, a person apply in writing to the President of the High Council of the National Public Prosecution Authority. The High Council of the National Public Prosecution Authority organizes recruitment test to fill vacant posts. Provisions of this Article do not apply to Prosecutor General, the Deputy Prosecutor General and Chief Prosecutor at the Intermediate Level.”

provisions.title: Article 14 - of Law n° 44 bis/2011 of 26/11/2011
provisions.content: governing the statute of Prosecutors and other staff the National Public Prosecution Authority is modified and complemented as follows: “Every Prosecutor assumes office by serving probationary period of six (6) months during which his/her immediate superior evaluates professional abilities and conduct. his/her The immediate superior referred to in Paragraph of this Article prepares the probationary period report at least one (1) month before the probationary period expires. The report is submitted to the Prosecutor General who, in turn, submits it to the High Council of the National Public Prosecution Authority with copy to the Prosecutor under probation. Where the High Council of the National Public Prosecution Authority finds that the report conclusively indicates that the Prosecutor probation has the required abilities, he/she permanently appointed as a career Prosecutor. The High Council of the National Public Prosecution Authority may, if it considers it necessary, extend probationary period. Such additional period probation cannot exceed six (6) months.”

provisions.title: Article 17 - of Law n° 44 bis/2011 of 26/11/2011
provisions.content: governing the statute of Prosecutors and other staff the National Public Prosecution Authority is modified and complemented as follows: “The Prosecutor General and the Deputy Prosecutor General are appointed for a term of office of five years renewable once. The Chief Prosecutor at the Intermediate Level appointed for a term of office of five (5) years which may be renewed by the High Council of the National Public Prosecution Authority. The term of office of Prosecutors referred to Paragraphs One and 2 of this Article begins from date they assume office. The Chief Prosecutor at the Intermediate Level whose term of office is not renewed remains Prosecutor at Intermediate Level.”

provisions.title: Article 18 - of Law n° 44 bis/2011 of 26/11/2011
provisions.content: governing the statute of Prosecutors and other staff the National Public Prosecution Authority is modified and complemented as follows: “Before assuming office, each Prosecutor must the oath provided for by the Constitution of Republic of Rwanda of 2003 revised in 2015. The Prosecutor General and the Deputy Prosecutor General take their oaths of office before the President of the Republic. Other Prosecutors take oath before the Prime Minister in the presence of members of the High Council of National Public Prosecution Authority. The document containing the text of the oath is signed by the person taking oath and the person administering the oath.”

provisions.title: Article 19 - of Law n° 44 bis/2011 of 26/11/2011
provisions.content: governing the statute of Prosecutors and other staff the National Public Prosecution Authority is modified and complemented as follows: “During court proceedings, Prosecutors appropriate dress determined by the Prosecutor General upon consultation with the High Council the Public Prosecution.”

provisions.title: Article 21 - of Law n° 44 bis/2011 of 26/11/2011
provisions.content: governing the statute of Prosecutors and other staff the National Public Prosecution Authority is modified and complemented as follows: “Any Prosecutor who fails to perform his/her duties or to comply with the code of conduct for Prosecutors is punished by one of the following sanctions, through a written notice, depending on the seriousness of fault: 1º warning; 2º blame; 3º suspension for a period of three (3) to six months without monthly salary; 4º delay in promotion; 5º removal from a managerial position; 6º dismissal.”

provisions.title: Article 26 - of Law n° 44 bis/2011 of 26/11/2011
provisions.content: governing the statute of Prosecutors and other staff the National Public Prosecution Authority is modified and complemented as follows: “In case of emergency, the Prosecutor General suspend a Prosecutor from office, except those are members of the Bureau of the Prosecutor General, to ensure smooth running of duties until a decision is taken on serious misconduct alleged against him/her. However, as regards a Prosecutor at the Intermediate Level or a Prosecutor at the Primary Level, Prosecutor General first requests in writing a written opinion of the Chief Prosecutor at the Intermediate Level. The High Council of the National Public Prosecution Authority must examine the matter in its first meeting following the submission of the complaint and takes decision in one (1) month following the first meeting that examined the matter. Such suspension immediately ceases to have effect the complaint is not referred to the High Council the National Public Prosecution Authority within month as provided for by Article 29 of this Law. The suspension referred to in this Article shall not made public and shall in no way prejudice entitlement to the salary.”

provisions.title: Article 28 - of Law n° 44 bis/2011 of 26/11/2011
provisions.content: governing the statute of Prosecutors and other staff the National Public Prosecution Authority is modified and complemented as follows: “Procedure for sanctions for Prosecutors does commence unless the concerned person is required writing to provide explanations. The Prosecutor must provide explanations within period not exceeding fifteen (15) days of receipt of letter requesting him/her to provide explanations. All information in connection with the imposition sanctions is provided in writing and kept in the file the concerned person.”

provisions.title: Article 30 - of Law n° 44 bis/2011 of 26/11/2011
provisions.content: governing the statute of Prosecutors and other staff the National Public Prosecution Authority is modified and complemented as follows: “A Prosecutor against whom a complaint is filed summoned by way of a letter written by the President of the High Council of the National Public Prosecution Authority in the following manner: 1º registered mail; 2º a letter delivered to him/her by a competent authority; 3º a letter delivered to him/her by a Prosecutor higher level. In the absence of the Prosecutor at home, the letter given to the spouse or a relative aged at least sixteen (16) years and who resides with the concerned Prosecutor. In case of absence of the above-mentioned persons, the letter is given to the Executive Secretary of the Cell of his/her domicile or residence. The registered mail is delivered to him/her at fifteen (15) days before the meeting examining his/her case is held. The period begins from the day the registered mail deposited with the post office with acknowledgment of receipt or hand-delivered to the accused Prosecutor. An electronic channel may also be used, where a letter summoning a Prosecutor is sent to the electronic given by the accused Prosecutor or other electronic means.”

provisions.title: Article 39 - quater is inserted in Law n° 44 bis/2011
provisions.content: 26/11/2011 governing the statute of Prosecutors other staff of the National Public Prosecution Authority, to read as follows: “Article 39 quater: Conditions for rehabilitation “Rehabilitation may be granted if there is sufficient evidence to indicate that the sanctioned person expressed remorse and is characterised by good conduct. A dismissed Prosecutor may, if he/she so requests writing, be rehabilitated by the sanctioning organ upon proposal by the High Council of the National Public Prosecution Authority. He/she applies rehabilitation at least after seven (7) years from date the sanction was imposed. A Prosecutor who commits a fault sanctioned sanction other than dismissal may, if he/she requests in writing, be rehabilitated after approval the High Council of the National Public Prosecution Authority after three (3) years from the imposition the sanction.”

provisions.title: Article 15 - Prescription of disciplinary fault
provisions.content: sanctions

provisions.title: Article 40 - of Law n°44 bis/2011 of 26/11/2011
provisions.content: governing the statute of Prosecutors and other staff the National Public Prosecution Authority is modified and complemented as follows: “Except the Prosecutor General and the Deputy Prosecutor General of the National Public Prosecution Authority, each Prosecutor undergoes an annual performance appraisal. The performance appraisal intends to enlighten Administration on the Prosecutor’s performance professional abilities. It forms the essential basis assessing his/her right to promotion in horizontal scale, from one step to another and to salary increase and related special gratification. The concerned Prosecutor is notified of the entire results of the performance appraisal. A Prosecutor who is not satisfied with results of final performance appraisal may appeal to the High Council of the National Public Prosecution Authority. An Order of the Prime Minister determines modalities governing the conduct of performance appraisal, promotion in horizontal scale and granting annual special gratification for prosecutors.”

provisions.title: Article 20 - Effects of secondment or placement
provisions.content: the disposal of another administration

provisions.title: Article 54 - of Law n°44/2011 of 26/11/2011 governing
provisions.content: the statute of Prosecutors and other staff of National Public Prosecution Authority is modified complemented as follows: “In case a Prosecutor or an Assistant to Prosecutors placed on secondment or at the disposal of another administration, a new Prosecutor or Assistant Prosecutors is appointed to replace him/her. When the period of secondment or placement at disposal of another administration is over, except grounds of sanctions, the Prosecutor or Assistant Prosecutors is automatically reinstated into his/her previous post if the post is available. In case the he/she occupied before secondment or placement another administration has been allocated to another person, the employer provides him/her with another post of the same level as the one he/she held before secondment or find him/her another post upon his/her consent. In case the post is not found, the Prosecutor Assistant to Prosecutor is suspended from duties receives two-thirds (2/3) of his/her net salary corresponding to his/her latest grade for a period of (6) months. The payment of this salary stops when a prosecutor or an assistant to prosecutors finds another permanent job. Where another post is found, priority is given to Prosecutor or Assistant to Prosecutors that seconded or placed at another administration disposal. If the period of six (6) months expires before a person that was seconded or placed at another administration disposal finds a permanent job, he/she is automatically removed from office and receives termination benefits.”

provisions.title: Article 65 - of Law n° 44 bis/2011 of 26/11/2011
provisions.content: governing the statute of Prosecutors and other staff the National Public Prosecution Authority is modified and complemented as follows: “When a Prosecutor or an assistant to prosecutors automatically dismissed due to suppression of post, he/she is entitled to termination benefits calculated on the basis of the gross salary and paid the following manner: 1º one (1) month for Prosecutors or Assistants Prosecutors with less than five (5) years service; 2º two (2) months for Prosecutors or Assistants prosecutors with at least five (5) years but less than ten (10) years in service; 3º six (6) months for Prosecutors or Assistants Prosecutors with at least ten years (10) in service.”

provisions.title: Article 68 - of the law n° 44 bis/2011 of 26/11/2011
provisions.content: governing the statute of Prosecutors and other staff the National Public Prosecution Authority is modified and complemented as follows: “With the exception of the Prosecutor General Deputy Prosecutor General, the retirement age prosecutor or an assistant to prosecutors is sixty (65) years. However, it may be extended to seventy (70) years upon application of the interested prosecutor or assistant to prosecutors when he/she able to continue and only in the interest of service. The retirement may also be granted due to personal reasons, if he/she is at least sixty (60) years. The decision of retirement, whether at the retirement age or prematurely is made by the High Council of National Public Prosecution Authority upon proposal by the Prosecutor General. Retirement benefits for a retired prosecutor assistant to prosecutors are granted according to relevant laws”.

provisions.title: Article 23 - Other staff of the National Public
provisions.content: Prosecution Authority

provisions.title: Article 74 - of Law n° 44 bis/2011 of 26/11/2011
provisions.content: governing the statute of Prosecutors and other staff the National Public Prosecution Authority is modified and complemented as follows: “With exception of Prosecutors, other members staff of the National Public Prosecution Authority 1º Inspectors; 2º Secretary General; 3º Assistants to Prosecutors; 4º Other required members of staff.”

provisions.title: Article 24 - Requirements to be appointed as
provisions.content: Inspector of the National Public Prosecution Authority

provisions.title: Article 75 - of Law n° 44 bis/2011 of 26/11/2011
provisions.content: governing the statute of Prosecutors and other staff the National Public Prosecution Authority is modified and complemented as follows: “In order to be appointed an Inspector of the National Public Prosecution Authority, the candidate must prosecutor at the national level. He/she must also a working experience of at least five (5) years prosecutor. The Inspector General of the National Public Prosecution Authority must have served in the field for at least eight (8) years for holders bachelor’s degree or five (5) years for holders Master’s degree or a PhD in law awarded by recognised university or institution of higher learning. He /she must have a working experience of at five (5) years in prosecution. An Inspector of the National Public Prosecution Authority has a prosecutor’s status. Inspectors of the National Public Prosecution Authority are appointed and dismissed by the High Council of the National Public Prosecution Authority. Inspectors are under the hierarchy of the Inspector General and under the supervision of the Prosecutor General. While the inspectors of the National Public Prosecution Authority perform the duty of inspection, they are not allowed to perform the duty of crime investigation.”

provisions.title: Article 25 - Requirements to be appointed Assistant
provisions.content: to Prosecutors

provisions.title: Article 77 - of Law n° 44 bis/2011 of 26/11/2011
provisions.content: governing the statute of Prosecutors and other staff the National Public Prosecution Authority is modified and complemented as follows: “In order to be appointed as an Assistant Prosecutors, the candidate must fulfil the requirements provided for under Article 10 of this Law. In order to be appointed as an Assistant to Prosecutors at the Primary Level, the candidate must fulfil requirements provided for under Article 10 of Law. In order to be appointed as an Assistant to Prosecutors at intermediate level, the candidate must also have working experience of at least one (1) year in field. In order to be appointed as a chief Assistant Prosecutors at Intermediate Level, the candidate also have a working experience of at least two years in legal field. In order to be appointed as an Assistant of Prosecutors at National level, the candidate must also fulfil conditions required to be a prosecutor at intermediate level. In order to be appointed as a chief Assistant Prosecutors at national level, the candidate must fulfil the conditions required to be a Chief Intermediate Prosecutor.”

provisions.title: Article 27
provisions.content: Prosecutors Taking oath of Assistants In Law n° 44 bis/2011 of 26/11/2011 governing statute of Prosecutors and other staff of the National Public Prosecution Authority, article 77 ter is inserted to read as follows: “Article 77 ter: Taking oath of Assistants Prosecutors Before assuming office, Assistants to Prosecutors the oath provided for in the Constitution of Republic of Rwanda of 2003 revised in 2015 before the Prosecutor General.”

provisions.title: Article 29 - Supervision of Assistants of Prosecutors
provisions.content: In Law n° 44 bis/2011 of 26/11/2011 governing statute of Prosecutors and other staff of the National Public Prosecution Authority, Article 77 quinquies inserted to read as follows: “Article 77 quinquies: Supervision of Assistants Prosecutors In performing their duties, Assistants to Prosecutors are under the direct hierarchy of the chief assistant prosecutors at the level where they are posted supervised by the Prosecutor who is in charge at level. Assistants to Prosecutors at the Primary Level supervised by the chief assistant to prosecutors at Intermediate Level.”

provisions.title: Article 31 - Performance appraisal, disciplinary
provisions.content: regime and rehabilitation for other staff of National Public Prosecution Authority

provisions.title: Article 78 - of Law n° 44 bis/2011 of 26/11/2011
provisions.content: governing the statute of prosecutors and other staff the National Public Prosecution Authority is modified and complemented as follows: “The performance appraisal, disciplinary regime rehabilitation for other staff of the National Public Prosecution Authority governed by this Law is same as those of prosecutors.”

provisions.title: Article 81of - Law n° 44 bis/2011 of 26/11/2011
provisions.content: governing the statute of prosecutors and other staff the National Public Prosecution Authority is modified and complemented as follows: “The salary and fringe benefits for prosecutors, inspectors, the Secretary General and assistants prosecutors are determined by a Presidential Order.”

provisions.title: Article 33 - Appointment of Prosecutors and other
provisions.content: staff of the National Public Prosecution Authority

provisions.title: Article 89 - of Law n° 44 bis/2011 of 26/11/2011
provisions.content: governing the statute of prosecutors and other staff the National Public Prosecution Authority is modified and complemented as follows: “The National Public Prosecution Authority establishes modalities to assist in service Prosecutors, Inspectors of the National Public Prosecution Authority and Assistants to Prosecutors who do hold a Diploma awarded by a recognized institute legal practice and development to obtain such diploma. Prosecutors, Inspectors of the National Public Prosecution Authority and Assistants to prosecutors currently in service who do not have the certificate awarded by a recognised institute of legal practice development are given a period of seven (7) years from the publication of this Law in the Official Gazette of the Republic of Rwanda to have such certificate. Within a period of five (5) years following the date the publication of this Law, prosecutors and assistants to prosecutors are appointed regardless of requirements of this Law on matters concerning certificate from a recognized professional institute.”

provisions.title: Article 34 - Drafting, consideration and adoption
provisions.content: this Law This Law was drafted, considered and adopted Kinyarwanda.

provisions.title: Article 35 - Repealing provision
provisions.content: Articles 2, 3, 4, 5, 41, 42 and 43 of Law n° 44 bis/2011 of 26/11/2011 governing the statute of Prosecutors and other staff of the National Public Prosecution Authority and all prior provisions contrary to this are hereby repealed.
